content: Campus visit transforms casual interest into emotional commitment. Dad observation: 'She was completely disconnected from us, just following the student guide.' Huda mesmerized by School of Cinematic Arts. First proper family college tour creates unified excitement. Discovery: USC admits 8000 out of 82000 (9.7%), no waitlist system, uses spring admissions instead. Regional advantage confirmed: Mountain House in tier 2 (less competitive grouping).

Major pivot: BFA Interactive Media discovered as limitation. Jenny: 'It's a Bachelor of Fine Arts, that's like an art degree. Can't combine with other majors easily.' Solution: BS Computer Science Games provides flexibility while maintaining game development focus. Strategic major ordering: First choice CS Games (BS), second Media Arts & Practice (BA with creative coding), third Journalism (BA). Benefit: Early action eligibility November 1st vs December 1st for BFA. Portfolio requirement eliminated.

confidence_score.content: Jenny vulnerability shared: Got stranded in Central Park when phone died. Humor: 'Didn't get kidnapped, didn't get murdered.' Learning moment: 'Taught me how to read maps.' Dad's digital twin Jenny AI project shown, Jenny genuine reaction: 'This is good! This is really good! Quality is simply amazing.' Finance internship reality: '8:45am to 6:30pm, worse hours than tech but people are nice, seeing Broadway show tomorrow.' Human behind advisor role.

Real-time major pivot during session after discovering BFA limitations. Immediate solution: Switch to BS Computer Science Games. Benefits cascade: maintains game focus + interdisciplinary flexibility + early action eligibility + no portfolio needed. Dad reaction: 'So no need of portfolio then. Yay!' Payment model discovery: Previous free bootcamp had low engagement. New approach: charge small amount even if donated to cause. Requirement identified: Need 501c3 status for legitimacy.

USC application architecture: 3 major choices allowed with strategic ordering. Early action November 1st for non-portfolio majors, December 1st for School of Cinematic Arts. Both deadlines qualify for merit scholarships. Regional officer framework: Territorial admissions management means Mountain House grouped with less competitive schools (tier 2), while Dublin/Dougherty Valley in different tier. School profile critically important for context.

Session outcomes: Major confirmed (BS Computer Science Games), early action secured (November 1st), portfolio eliminated, family fully invested after campus tour, Empowering AI reached 95 followers approaching 100 milestone, VP activated after secretary departure, international India contributor joined producing content, government recognition path identified, payment model clarity for future programs. Strategic discoveries: BFA limits flexibility, BS provides interdisciplinary options, regional tier 2 advantage confirmed.

Multi-channel execution: TikTok daily posts driving traffic, LinkedIn generating website visits, Instagram 95 followers for Empowering AI, Slack professional team communication, Reddit attempted but low follow-through. Collaboration channels identified: Kode with Klossy newsletter opportunity, Youth Action Committee legislative connections, other nonprofit collaboration posts needed. Dad recorded USC presentation for reference, AI game plan demo shared.

College application admission: 'I only basically applied to Stanford' but knows USC well despite not applying. Finance internship hours comparison: 'Worse than tech companies.' Central Park adventure with dead phone: 'Taught me how to read maps.' Genuine excitement about dad's AI project: 'Quality is simply amazing!' Social media persistence wisdom: 'You might blow up but won't know until that day.' Content creation validation: 'That sounds really cool, pursue that for sure.'

The Quitting Catalyst Effect: Secretary departure unexpectedly energized remaining team. VP became 'really active,' followers grew from ~50 to 95. Psychology: losing dead weight forces others to step up or organization fails. Creates urgency especially for rising seniors (last chance for college apps). Summer timing advantage: team has free time. Redistribute best tasks with new titles, celebrate milestones publicly, set consequences for non-performance. Key insight: team not working harder despite loss—working harder because of it. Discovery they CAN succeed without underperformer is empowering.
